intro: Leptogramma crenata, commonly known as the serrated fern, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its finely divided, feather-like leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its small, clustered flowers are usually white or pale green, and it produces small, fleshy fruits. Leptogramma crenata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
